column4: i am trying remote mount a fs using sshfs and it is failing.. anyone can suggest what I am doing wrong here? http://pastebin.com/BW86C0Ne
Can you log into the remote machine via normal ssh?
yes..
mmm.  What errors do you get when you try to mount?
u mean try fusemount ?
It should work without fusemount
mount it self gets no error.. it shows nothing mounted on /ftp0
http://pastebin.com/c5r5RKsv
let me in right away
That's odd.  Does df -h show it as mounted?
not mounted
mmmm
sudo sshfs ftp0: /ftp works just fine
I thought you just said it wasn't mounting?
not if I run as me ..
oh sudo.  Well that explains that.  you need to change the permissions on /ftp
my original pastebin shows I did the chown first
http://pastebin.com/BW86C0Ne
Do you have permissison to read the folder you're mounting on the remote machine?
yes .. ssh ftp0: and i see my home dir fine.. that is what I am trying to mount
maxo: found the problem !
All those methods will take the same amount of time
